alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Grayson; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wythe, northwestern Carroll and eastern Grayson Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elk Creek, or near Speedwell, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wytheville... Independence... Fries... Max Meadows... Patterson... Speedwell... and Fort Chiswell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northwestern North Carolina...and southwestern Virginia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Virginia...and southeastern West Virginia. Additional statements will be issued as conditions warrant.
